$description: | What does this do? | Sign-ins detected as high risk are to be blocked via Conditional Access. | | Why should you use this? | Azure AD Identity Protection uses various signals to detect the risk level for each sign-in. High risk sign-ins should not be blocked until further investigation. | | What is the end-user impact? | High Impact. Once a respective conditional access policy is implemented, if a high-risk user attempts to login, the user will receive an error message with instructions to contact the administrator to re-enable their access | | Learn more | [Create Risk Policies](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/howto-conditional-access-policy-risk) |

excludeGroups: ${urn:resource:MSGraph:Groups/Baseline - Unrestricted Access From Unmanaged Devices And Untrusted Locations--Baseline-UnrestrictedAccessFromUnmanagedDevicesAndUntrustedLocat?id}
